summary: Leslie H. Wizelman was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll and certification reports spanning from October 1977 to November 1978. These documents detail her position and salary within the committee during this period. While the specific role of Wizelman is not explicitly stated in the provided summaries, her presence on these official payroll documents indicates her involvement in the operations of the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Leslie H. Wizelman's significance lies in her employment within the HSCA, the committee tasked with reinvestigating the JFK assassination. Her presence on payroll and certification reports confirms her involvement in the committee's operations during a specific timeframe (October 1977 - November 1978). While her exact role is not detailed, her employment contributes to the overall picture of the HSCA's staffing and resource allocation during its investigation.
